title: Virtual Lecture: Conservation of the Hartwell Memorial Window
title_display: Virtual Lecture: Conservation of the Hartwell Memorial Window
hero_caption: Conservator Rachel Sabino works on one of the 48 panels that make up the Hartwell Memorial Window.
short_description: Join objects conservator Rachel Sabino as she shares her insights on the conservation and installation of the Hartwell Memorial Window.
list_description: Join objects conservator Rachel Sabino as she shares her insights on the conservation and installation of the Hartwell Memorial Window.
description:
Join objects conservator Rachel Sabino as she illuminates the groundbreaking conservation and installation of the Hartwell Memorial Window. Learn how Art Institute colleagues worked internally and with external partners to realize a novel approach to stained glass display that is a feat of engineering and mount making. And discover how close examination of the panels revealed new insight into Tiffany Studios' process.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
